standards.header: Physiotherapy services are provided by qualified therapists.

details.header: A physiotherapist qualified by education, training, and experience manages the physiotherapy department.
details: The department head supervises all aspects of physiotherapy services in the hospital.
The department head develops a written scope of services of the physiotherapy department.
The department head recommends space and equipment to meet the scope of services.

details.header: Staff members are qualified by appropriate education, training, and experience in physical rehabilitation.

standards.header: Policies, procedures and protocols guide the care of patients undergoing physiotherapy in the hospital.

details.header: Policies, procedures, and protocols include, but are not limited to, the following:
Policies are collaboratively developed with the medical staff, nursing staff, and other relevant departments.

standards.header: Patients identified to be at functional risk have comprehensive functional assessment performed.

details.header: Functional screening is conducted by qualified hospital staff (e.g., registered nurse) to determine the patient’s need for a comprehensive functional assessment by a licensed therapist.
The criteria used for functional screening during the initial assessment of patients are developed and approved by qualified therapists
Comprehensive functional assessment is performed by a qualified therapist for each patient identified at functional risk during the initial screening or assessment.
Functional assessment is completed within twenty four hours of referral.
The comprehensive functional assessment is described in a policy and procedure.
Functional screening and assessment findings are documented in the patient’s medical record.

standards.header: Patients with functional disorder(s) have an appropriate plan of care that meets their needs.

details.header: The physiotherapist, in collaboration with other clinical staff, develops a suitable plan of care for patients with functional disorders.
The plan of care meets the medical needs of the patient.
The plan of care has measurable goals.
Patients are educated about the plan of care and the procedures and rehabilitative exercises.
Patients are reassessed by a physiotherapist at regular intervals, their response to the plan of care is monitored, and adjustments are made accordingly.
The plan of care is documented in the patient’s medical record as part of multidisciplinary team planning, whenever applicable.
